title: R installation fails on MacOS high Sierra
body:
Hi everyone, I encountered an issue while trying to install r using spack on MacOS. Here are the details of the problem. I appreciate any suggestions. 

P.S. 
I do have another mac and on that one, everything works fine. So it has to be something with this one's setup...

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install r@3.4.2


==> bzip2 is already installed in /Users/a.kamil.cygan/spack/opt/spack/darwin-highsierra-x86_64/clang-9.1.0-apple/bzip2-1.0.6-73vi2erii7dtejj6d2mrpwzltbiqhpps
```

### Information in compilers.yaml
```console

compilers:
- compiler:
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
    flags: {}
    modules: []
    operating_system: highsierra
    paths:
      cc: /usr/bin/clang
      cxx: /usr/bin/clang++
      f77: /usr/local/bin/gfortran
      fc: /usr/local/bin/gfortran
    spec: clang@9.1.0-apple
    target: x86_64
- compiler:
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
    flags: {}
    modules: []
    operating_system: highsierra
    paths:
      cc: /usr/local/bin/gcc-8
      cxx: /usr/local/bin/g++-8
      f77: /usr/local/bin/gfortran-8
      fc: /usr/local/bin/gfortran-8
    spec: gcc@8.1.0
    target: x86_64

```
-----
